benchmark_details.name: LoHoSet
benchmark_details.overview: LoHoSet is designed for training the LoHoVLA model on long-horizon embodied tasks and consists of 20 long-horizon tasks with 1,000 expert demonstrations each, featuring visual observations, linguistic goals, sub-tasks, and robot actions.
benchmark_details.data_type: visual observations, linguistic goals, sub-tasks, and robot actions

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a dataset for training and evaluating a unified vision-language-action model for long-horizon embodied tasks.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The precision of robot actions may be limited due to the discrete nature of commands.

methodology.calculation: Scores are generated based on the proportion of correctly completed steps in each task.
methodology.interpretation: A higher score indicates better performance in task completion.
methodology.baseline_results: LoHoVLA outperformed both hierarchical and vanilla VLA models on various metrics.
